titleStmt.title: Thursday the tenth of September, 1657. At the Council at VVhite-hall. His highness the Lord Protector and his Privy Council, being very sensible of the hand of the Lord, which for some moneths past hath layen sore upon this land, in the present visitation by sickness throughout the nation, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1653-1658 : O. Cromwell)

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Henry Hills and John Field, Printers to His Highness the Lord Protector,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Signed at end: Hen: Scobell, Clerk of the Council.
Wednesday, 30 Sept., appointed a day of humiliation for the sickness for all England and Wales. -- Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
